conclusion: Analyze forces and displacements in the spring system.
Given information about mass, spring constants, and positions.
Initially, object A is at rest, spring B is compressed, and spring C is undeformed.
At initial position, forces balance: weight of A equals spring force from B.
Calculate weight of A: F_weight = 19.6 N.
Spring force from B initially: F_B,initial = 19.6 N.
Initial compression of spring B: x₁ = 9.8 cm.
When spring C is pulled to position b, object A rises by height h.
At position b, spring B is less compressed, spring C is extended by 0.6 m.
Tension in spring C pulls object A upward.
At position b, tension force of spring B equals gravitational force of A.
Calculate height h: h = 0, object A doesn't rise.
Spring C is stretched by 0.6 m, creating a force equal to weight of A.
Calculate spring constant k₂: k₂ = 32.67 N/m.
Final answer: height A rises is 0 m, spring constant k₂ is 32.67 N/m.
